free.util
Class IOUtilities

java.lang.Object
  free.util.IOUtilities

public class IOUtilities
extends java.lang.Object

Various utility methods that have something to do with I/O.

Constructor Detail

IOUtilities

public IOUtilities()
Method Detail

maybeCreateDataOutputStream

public static java.io.DataOutputStream maybeCreateDataOutputStream(java.io.OutputStream out)
Returns a DataOutputStream object based on the given OutputStream. If the given OutputStream is already an instance of DataOutputStream, the same (given) OutputStream is casted to DataOutputStream and returned, otherwise, a new wrapper DataOutputStream is created and returned.

maybeCreateDataInputStream

public static java.io.DataInputStream maybeCreateDataInputStream(java.io.InputStream in)
Returns a DataInputStream object based on the given InputStream. If the given InputStream is already an instance of DataInputStream, the same (given) InputStream is casted to DataInputStream and returned, otherwise, a new wrapper DataInputStream is created and returned.

copyDir

public static void copyDir(java.io.File source,
                           java.io.File destination,
                           boolean recurse)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Copies all the files of the given source directory into the given destination directory, optionally recursively.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

rmdir

public static boolean rmdir(java.io.File dir)
Removes the given directory and all files within it, recursively. Returns true if successful, false otherwise. Note that if it return false, some (or all) the files in the directory may already be deleted.

pump

public static int pump(java.io.InputStream in,
                       java.io.OutputStream out)
                throws java.io.IOException
Writes the bytes read from the given input stream into the given output stream until the end of the input stream is reached. Returns the amount of bytes actually read/written.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

pump

public static int pump(java.io.InputStream in,
                       java.io.OutputStream out,
                       int amount)
                throws java.io.IOException
Writes up to the given amount of bytes read from the given input stream into the given output stream until the end of the input stream is reached. Returns the amount of bytes actually read/written.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

pump

public static int pump(java.io.InputStream in,
                       java.io.OutputStream out,
                       byte[] buf)
                throws java.io.IOException
Writes the bytes read from the given input stream into the given output stream until the end of the input stream is reached. Returns the amount of bytes actually read/written. Uses the given byte array as the buffer.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

pump

public static int pump(java.io.InputStream in,
                       java.io.OutputStream out,
                       int amount,
                       byte[] buf)
                throws java.io.IOException
Writes up to the given amount of bytes read from the given input stream into the given output stream until the end of the input stream is reached. Returns the amount of bytes actually read/written. Uses the given byte array as the buffer.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

readToEnd

public static byte[] readToEnd(java.io.InputStream in)
                        throws java.io.IOException
Reads from the given InputStream until its end and returns a byte array of the contents. Note that this method doesn't close the given InputStream, that is left to the user.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

loadText

public static java.lang.String loadText(java.io.InputStream in)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
Reads all the information from the given InputStream and returns it as plain text by using the default system encoding. Note that this method doesn't close the given InputStream, that is left to the user.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

loadText

public static java.lang.String loadText(java.net.URL url)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
Loads the text from the given URL and returns it as a string.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the given URL does not exist or an I/O error occurs while accessing it.

loadTextFile

public static java.lang.String loadTextFile(java.io.File file)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
Loads the given text file from the local drive, converts it to a String and returns the String.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the file does not exist or loading failed.

loadTextFile

public static java.lang.String loadTextFile(java.lang.String filename)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
Loads a text file with the given name from the local drive, converts it to a String and returns the String.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the file does not exist or loading failed.

equal

public static boolean equal(byte[] arr1,
                            int offset1,
                            byte[] arr2,
                            int offset2,
                            int length)
Compares the 2 given sub arrays. Returns true if they are equal, false otherwise.

Throws:
ArrayIndexOutOfBounds - if
  • offset1 or offset2 are negative.
  • length is negative.
  • offset1+length is bigger than arr1.length
  • offset2+length is bigger than arr2.length

fileToURL

public static java.net.URL fileToURL(java.io.File file)
Returns a URL corresponding to the specified File or null if the File cannot be converted into a URL. NOTE: This is copied from the JDK1.3 source, File.java
